lines.text: My name is Pym. This is Freddie Graves. We're in moving pictures.
Fitzwilliam. My partner Madam Cavalli. We're in debt.
[laughs]
Would you be able to carry a passenger?
You're a pianist, aren't ya?
I was.
Would you be looking for a job?
As a matter of fact I am.

[about Palmer]
Damn Yankee!
If he wants war, we shall give him war.
You have the choice of a bridal or a lady's bracelet.
I'll take the lady's bracelet.
Some lady is going to be very pleased.
It is a medicinal necessity.
But it makes you so like a beast.
Nonsense. I'm as gentle as a lamb.

[to Lucy]
I think you're the prettiest girl I've ever seen in my entire life.
My dear fellow, I've been in the picture show business for umm... twenty years, and I've never lost a customer.
Your repertoire must be tremendous.
Music can practically create pictures. What does that suggest?
I think coming action.
